intro: Diplazium comorensis, commonly known as the Comoros shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its shield-shaped fronds, which are typically dark green and leathery in texture. The plant is native to the Comoros Islands in the Indian Ocean and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine in the region. Diplazium comorensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
